definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: The first-order effects of the stirrup were dramatic.
sentences.chinese: 馬鐙的一階效應已是非常巨大。
“RL瑞龍”，壓花閃閃發光的金屬單管齊馬鐙扣。

sentences.english: Jane put one foot in the near stirrup and turned to look at the stranger.
sentences.chinese: 簡一隻腳就近蹬上馬鐙，轉臉看着陌生人。

sentences.english: The huge social changes wrought by the stirrup took centuries to play out.
sentences.chinese: 馬鐙引起的巨大社會變革花了幾個世紀才完成。

sentences.english: To get started, just put your left foot in the stirrup and swing your right foot over.
sentences.chinese: 開始的時候，把左腳放在馬鐙上，隨後跨上右腳。

sentences.english: If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup.
sentences.chinese: 講真話的人應該一隻腳踩在馬鐙裏。

sentences.english: Charlemagne had the stirrup. We have the computer.
sentences.chinese: 查理曼擁有馬鐙，我們擁有電腦。
